message.content:
cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.CYBER, cs.SOC

Reasoning: The paper discusses the development of intelligent computational agents that integrate both emotion and cognition, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of social-psychological theory to ground the development of these agents suggests that the paper may also fall under the sub-category of social and information sciences (cs.SI). The paper also discusses decision theoretic reasoning and exploration strategies in reinforcement learning, which are topics commonly found in the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and cyber security (cs.CYBER). Finally, the paper explores the role of affective alignment in human social interactions, which falls under the sub-category of social computing (cs.SOC).
